<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/&#42; ---------------------------------------------------------------------</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    Conversions between UTF32, UTF-16, and UTF-8.  Header file.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    Several funtions are included here, forming a complete set of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    conversions between the three formats.  UTF-7 is not included</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    here, but is handled in a separate source file.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    Each of these routines takes pointers to input buffers and output</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    buffers.  The input buffers are const.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    Each routine converts the text between &#42;sourceStart and sourceEnd,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    putting the result into the buffer between &#42;targetStart and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    targetEnd. Note: the end pointers are &#42;after&#42; the last item: e.g.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    &#42;(sourceEnd - 1) is the last item.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    The return result indicates whether the conversion was successful,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    and if not, whether the problem was in the source or target buffers.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    (Only the first encountered problem is indicated.)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    After the conversion, &#42;sourceStart and &#42;targetStart are both</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    updated to point to the end of last text successfully converted in</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    the respective buffers.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    Input parameters:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">        sourceStart - pointer to a pointer to the source buffer.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">                The contents of this are modified on return so that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">                it points at the next thing to be converted.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">        targetStart - similarly, pointer to pointer to the target buffer.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">        sourceEnd, targetEnd - respectively pointers to the ends of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">                two buffers, for overflow checking only.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    These conversion functions take a ConversionFlags argument. When this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    flag is set to strict, both irregular sequences and isolated surrogates</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    will cause an error.  When the flag is set to lenient, both irregular</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    sequences and isolated surrogates are converted.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    Whether the flag is strict or lenient, all illegal sequences will cause</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    an error return. This includes sequences such as: &lt;F4 90 80 80&gt;, &lt;C0 80&gt;,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    or &lt;A0&gt; in UTF-8, and values above 1114111 in UTF-32. Conformant code</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    must check for illegal sequences.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    When the flag is set to lenient, characters over 1114111 are converted</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="89"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    to the replacement character; otherwise (when the flag is set to strict)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    they constitute an error.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    Output parameters:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">        The value &quot;sourceIllegal&quot; is returned from some routines if the input</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">        sequence is malformed.  When &quot;sourceIllegal&quot; is returned, the source</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">        value will point to the illegal value that caused the problem. E.g.,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">        in UTF-8 when a sequence is malformed, it points to the start of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">        malformed sequence.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    Author: Mark E. Davis, 1994</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    Rev History: Rick McGowan, fixes &amp; updates May 2001</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">         Fixes &amp; updates, Sept 2001</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">------------------------------------------------------------------------ &#42;/</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#ifndef LLVM&#95;SUPPORT&#95;CONVERTUTF&#95;H</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#define LLVM&#95;SUPPORT&#95;CONVERTUTF&#95;H</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &lt;cstddef&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &lt;string&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#if defined(&#95;WIN32)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#include &lt;system&#95;error&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#endif</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Wrap everything in namespace llvm so that programs can link with llvm and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// their own version of the unicode libraries.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">namespace </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm">llvm</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/&#42; ---------------------------------------------------------------------</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    The following 4 definitions are compiler-specific.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    The C standard does not guarantee that wchar&#95;t has at least</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    16 bits, so wchar&#95;t is no less portable than unsigned short!</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    All should be unsigned values to avoid sign extension during</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    bit mask &amp; shift operations.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">------------------------------------------------------------------------ &#42;/</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="210"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/&#42;&#42;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212"><span class="doxyHighlightComment"> &#42; Convert an UTF8 StringRef to UTF8, UTF16, or UTF32 depending on</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"><span class="doxyHighlightComment"> &#42; WideCharWidth. The converted data is written to ResultPtr, which needs to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><span class="doxyHighlightComment"> &#42; point to at least WideCharWidth &#42; (Source.Size() + 1) bytes. On success,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><span class="doxyHighlightComment"> &#42; ResultPtr will point one after the end of the copied string. On failure,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><span class="doxyHighlightComment"> &#42; ResultPtr will not be changed, and ErrorPtr will be set to the location of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><span class="doxyHighlightComment"> &#42; the first character which could not be converted.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><span class="doxyHighlightComment"> &#42; \\return true on success.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><span class="doxyHighlightComment"> &#42;/</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab1193fb2b9530fcfa3442d1f9d2abb46">ConvertUTF8toWide</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> WideCharWidth, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">llvm::StringRef</a> Source,</span></CodeLine>
